reviewText: The episodes listed for this DVD set are wrong!
We enjoyed this, not because it is great drama, but because John Thaw did such a good acting job, and thus made it into very good drama.  Without him, I think that it would have been a flop
This set encompasses many venues: wars past and current, diplomacy, medicine, family. All informative and entertaining. Difficult to put down.

Perhaps my favorite episode is "Ancient History" where Kavanagh is a prosecuting attorney in a war crimes trial about a Polish immigrant doctor who is accused of conducting medical experiments on Jewish inmates of a concentration camp.  His skillful questioning of a mentally fragile Jewish woman reveals the truth and the doctor finally admits his role in Nazi atrocities with a chilling recital of how such "medical experiments" were necessary.  Kavanagh's son finds Nazi war crimes gripping and aids his father with intensive online research.
